chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

result.execSummary:
The defendant James C McCoy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Attempt Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

With Huber. Sentence credit of 82 days were
 granted if imposed.

Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
Comply with any Mental Health / Psychological evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate by agent.

No Contact with the victim, Brandon W. or L.W. (dob 08/05/14) or T.L. (dob 10/31/07).  No use or possession of illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
*Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Dated today, from the clerk to the Defendant, in response to Motion to Change Excess Sentence. 

05/04/17, per Judge Carter:Defendant's Motion misstates the Judgment of Conviction. A copy of JOC will be included. Motion is inaccurate on its face and is denied without a hearing, as it fails to state a claim, upon which relief can be granted.

Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant James C McCoy in court, in custody, with attorney Anthony D Cotton.   Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts #1-3 on amended criminal complaint. Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guity of Counts #1-3 on amended criminal complaint.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Cotton makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

9 MONTHS HUBER (CREDIT - 82 days)   *Concurrent with any other sentence*

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS   *May be transferred to Milwaukee County*

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____No Use or Possession of  illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____No contact with: victim, Brandon W. or or L.W. dob: 8/5/14 or T.L. dob: 10/31/07
____Mental Heath / Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate

COSTS:  $343.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

** Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**


COUNT #2:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

4 1/2 MONTHS HUBER  -  CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT #1   *Concurrent with any other sentence*

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS   *May be transferred to Milwaukee County*

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____No Use or Possession of  illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____No contact with: victim, Brandon W. or L.W. dob: 8/5/14 or T.L. dob: 10/31/07
____Mental Heath / Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate

COSTS:  $253.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)


COUNT #3:   IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

90 DAYS HUBER  -  CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT #1 & 2   *Concurrent with any other sentence*

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS   *May be transferred to Milwaukee County*

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____No Use or Possession of  illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____No contact with: victim, Brandon W. or or L.W. dob: 8/5/14 or T.L. dob: 10/31/07
____Mental Heath / Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate

COSTS:  $243.00 - DV surcharge is waived (to be paid as a condition of probation)
Arraignment at 03-07-2016 09:30 am
Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint or their residences.  Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.

Defendant James C McCoy in court, in custody, with Attorney Anthony D Cotton.   Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for review hearing - to review State's motion to reconsider commissioner's ruling.  Parties previously submitted briefs to the court.  Court finds that probable cause does exist that a felony was committed and reverses Commissioner's ruling from 1/6/16 and binds Defendant over for trial for reasons stated on the record.  Court addresses bail.  State gives statements regarding bail request.  Attorney Cotton makes statements regarding bail modification request. Court modifies/increases bail.  State to file information at next court date.  Court sets arraignment date.  Arraignment scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Supplemental Brief Regarding Standard of Review. Filed by Atty Ehrfurth.
Supplemental Motion For Reconsideration of Commissioner's Decision Denying Bindover. Filed by the State.
Review hearing at 02-24-2016 09:30 am

Defendant James C McCoy in court, in custody, with Atorney Christopher Ehrfurth for Attorney Anthony D Cotton.   Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for motion to reconsider decision from court commissioner.  State makes statements regarding its motion.  Court reviewed transcript from preliminary hearing.  Attorney Ehrfurth makes statements.  Court will allow parties to submit additional briefs on this issue.  Court orders parties to submit any briefs or additional submissions by 2/19/16.  Review hearing scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Reply to State's Motion to Reconsider Commissioner Lau's Ruling filed by Attorney Anthony Cotton
Motion for reconsideration of decision not to bind over felony, and reconsideration of decision to reduce cash bail filed by Assistant District Attorney Michael Thurston.
Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 01/06/16 preliminary & arraignment.
Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 12/30/15 preliminary hearing.
Hearing at 02-12-2016 10:00 am
Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint or their residences.  Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.

Defendant James C McCoy in court, in custody, with attorney Donna Kuchler for attorney Anthony D Cotton.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Case called for hearing.  Court does not find probable cause that a felony was committed. Court finds probable cause that a misdemeanor.  Pursuant to sec. 970.03 (8), the court amends count #1 of the complaint to sec. 940.19(1) Battery.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Atty. Kuchler moves to modify bail.  State objects to any modification of bail.  Court grants motion to modify bail.  Hearing scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Brief in Support of Defendant's Motion to Amend the Criminal Complaint to conform to the Evidence.
To Bind this case over to the Circuit Court received from Attorney Thurston.
Filed by Atty Cotton.
Preliminary hearing at 01-06-2016 03:00 pm

Defendant James C McCoy in court, in custody, with attorney Christopher Ehrfurth for attorney Anthony D Cotton.   Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for preliminary hearing.  Jamie R sworn and testifies on direct by Attorney Thurston.  Cross examination by Attorney Ehrfurth.  State rests and moves for bind over.  Attorney Ehrfurth makes closing statements.  Closing statements from Attorney Thurston.  Court adjourns the hearing and takes the matter under advisement.  Court indicates both counsel shall prepare a brief submission in support of their position including a lesser charge that may be appropriate.    Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
